material.mattext: What is the term for a series of commands used to format, organize and describe information on a Web page?
Markup language
Graphical user interface (GUI)
Cloud
Software-as-a-service (SaaS)
Which of the following is traditionally the standard markup language on the Web?
Hypertext Markup Language (HTML)
JavaScript
JScript
VBScript
Â What is the term for rules in an external text file that determine how to display HTML elements in your Web pages?
ascading Style Sheets (CSS)
Markup language
Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME)
Software-as-a-service (SaaS)
Why has the advent of mobile devices caused Web designers to modify their existing sites or create alternative sites?
Mobile devices have smaller screens that are used to view Web pages previously viewed only on much larger PC monitors.
Mobile devices work only in the cloud environment.
Mobile devices are incompatible with Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).
Mobile devices can render Web pages developed only using HTML and CSS.
Â Which of the following can you use to create markup language code (e.g., HTML)?
A text editor
A Common Gateway Interface (CGI) application
A Structured Query Language (SQL) application
A Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) application
Which of the following can you use to create HTML pages without writing any code manually?
A graphical user interface (GUI) editor
A Common Gateway Interface (CGI) markup editor
A text editor
A Structured Query Language (SQL) editor
Graphical user interface (GUI) HTML editor applications:
allow you to modify your HTML code manually.
provide options for more recent markup standards
have kept pace with the evolution of HTML.
do not allow you to modify your HTML code manually
What is a metalanguage?
A language that is used to create other languages
A language in which you need not define your own document language rules
A language that is used to describe the data from which Web pages are created
A language that is used to format Web pages
Which of the following are metalanguages?
Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML) and Extensible Markup Language (XML)
Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) and Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML)
Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML) and Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML)
Extensible Markup Language (XML) and Hypertext Markup Language (HTML)
What is the purpose of a Document Type Definition (DTD)?
The DTD contains a set of rules to which you want your HTML document to conform.
The DTD contains language elements used for defining other languages.
The DTD contains commands used to format, organize and describe information on a Web page.
The DTD contains a set of rules that determine how to display HTML elements in your Web pages.
Which HTML 4.01 flavor must you use to place Web pages inside each other to create separate panes in the browser window?
HTML 4.01 Frameset
HTML 4.01 Strict
HTML 4.01 Transitiona
HTML 4.01 Standard
Which of the following describe the data from which Web pages are created, but do not format Web pages?
Extensible Markup Language (XML) and Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML)
Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML) and Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML)
Extensible Markup Language (XML) and Hypertext Markup Language (HTML)
Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) and Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML)
The main goal of Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML) is to:
create a medium that would provide for the transition from HTML to XML.
create a medium that would provide for the transition from SGML to XML.
create a medium that would provide for the transition from SGML to HTML.
create a medium that would provide for the transition from HTML to SGML.
What does Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML) use to describe a document's visual layout?
Hypertext Markup Language (HTML)
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)
Extensible Markup Language (XML)
Document Type Definition (DTD)
What does Extensible Hypertext Markup Language (XHTML) use to organize the data on a Web page?
Extensible Markup Language (XML)
Hypertext Markup Language (HTML)
Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)
Document Type Definition (DTD)
Which of the following is no longer necessary when you use HTML5 to develop Web pages?
Installing a third-party plug-in to include video
Validating your markup code
Applying a single W3C standard consistently throughout your document
Avoiding proprietary language extensions and technology
The HTML Web development "trifecta" consists of:
HTML5, CSS and JavaScript.
HTML5, XHTML and XML.
XHTML, CSS and JavaScript.
XML, CSS and JavaScript.
Which of the following was enacted to protect the civil rights of people with disabilities, and includes mandates that electronic information be accessible to people with disabilities?
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act
Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI
Which of the following is an Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) compliance factor?
You must provide text-based alternatives to all non-text content (e.g., Java applets).
You must make documents available without requiring an associated style sheet.
You must identify all row and column headers when using tables for data.
You must make information equally available in color and without color.
Which of the following is a Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) concern?
Disabled people need to be able to use development tools.
All images should have text-based descriptions so that sight-impaired visitors can access sites through screen-reader technology.
All non-text content should be provided with text-base alternatives.
Forms should be easily read by screen-reading technology.

Which of the following requires that all electronic and information technology developed, procured, maintained or used specifically by federal agencies be comparably accessible to users with disabilities?
Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI)
Which of the following accommodates Web users with vision impairment?
Ensuring that all pages and page elements can be rendered by audio screen readers
Designing Web pages so that they do not require large, expensive screen resolutions
Ensuring that a text-based equivalent of audio content is readily available
Providing navigation aids
A storyboard is a document that describes the:
purpose and intended audience for a Web site, and provides a rough outline of the pages needed.
design elements you will use in your Web site.
demographic and cultural issues your Web site will address.
organizational design standards to which your Web site must adhere.
Generally, successful Web sites:
have a strong, central theme aimed at a distinct audience.
use small fonts to include as much information as possible on each page to minimize the need to navigate to other pages.
use imaginative color schemes to be as eye-catching as possible.
use as many images as possible to act as hot spots to other site areas and pages.
Which of the following is the most appropriate reason to create multiple Web sites in various languages?
To accommodate an international audience
To ensure that your sites are ethnically diverse
To ensure that your sites are culturally sensitive
To teach site visitors words and phrases in different languages
Â If your Web development team includes a marketing representative, which of the following would probably be of most concern to that person?
How well the Web site adheres to branding standards
How well the Web site addresses relevant customer needs
The Web technology to use to best meet the organization's needs
The ease with which network servers can be configured
When conducting a Web development project meeting, why might it be useful to have a third party deliver a summary of progress?
A third party may help ensure clarity in meetings that include technical and non-technical participants.
A third party is usually the one that approves project milestones.
A third party is usually the most adept at leading discussions that include technical and non-technical participants.
A third party may be better able to dissipate animosity among meeting participants.
Why should you test Web pages using multiple Web browsers during site development?
To ensure that the pages render properly in all browsers
To ensure that non-technical team members understand the purpose and intended audience for the site
To increase the likelihood that all stakeholders will approve the site
To minimize the number of meetings held during the development phase
Which of the following is a command-line text-only Web browser?
Lynx
Chrome
Opera
Internet Explorer
Why is Lynx often used by those who are visually impaired?
Because it is a command-line text-only Web browser that can be used with software that renders text into voice
Because it is an open-source Web browser
Because it is included with various versions of the Windows operating system
Because it is included with most versions of UNIX/Linux
Which of the following can be considered a site management task after a Web site becomes active?
Update dead links and remove unused pages.
Determine the audience and message.
Validate design issues.
Create a site plan.
What is the term for a Web user who publishes comments or submits feedback simply to annoy or anger?
Troll
Hacker
Spammer
Blogger
Before making any changes to an active Web site, you should:
obtain a consensus of opinion about changes from customers, upper management, sales, and marketing, then obtain appropriate stakeholder approval.
determine if your Web development team can be reassembled.
redesign the storyboard based on feedback you have obtained since the site's inception.
obtain a consensus of opinion about changes from trolls, then obtain appropriate stakeholder approval.
What can be considered a drawback of obtaining feedback about your Web site by conducting customer surveys via e-mail?
Your organization runs the risk of receiving a bad reputation as a spammer.
Most customers who answer e-mail surveys have idiosyncratic perspectives.
You increase your chances of receiving prank information from trolls.
You are able to contact more customers than if you were to conduct the survey in person.
What is the term for the legal ownership of expression by an author?
Copyright
License
Trademark
Trade secret
What is the term for a unique word, phrase or symbol that is claimed or officially registered by an organization with the government?
Trademark
Copyright
License
Trade secret
Providing a link from your Web site to another site without permission is considered:
unethical.
copyright infringement.
trademark infringement.
plagiarism.
Why should you use a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) when you outsource Web development work to workers in remote locations?
To protect your organization's trade secrets or intellectual property from being revealed without your consent
To grant permission for the workers to use copyrighted material
To grant permission for the workers to use trademarks
To grant permission for the workers to use trade secrets
Which site planning tool describes an outline for a Web presence?
Wireframe
Site diagram
Storyboard
Site map
What is the difference between an ISP and a cloud service provider?

An ISP provides bandwidth and possibly Web server space, whereas a cloud service provider provides more complex services such as software-as-a-service (SaaS), backup services and database connectivity.
An ISP requires you to manage your own server, including security services, whereas a cloud service provider generally provides limited CGI and small databases.

A cloud service provider provides bandwidth and possibly Web server space, whereas an ISP provides more complex services such as software-as-a-service (SaaS), backup services and database connectivity.
A cloud service provider typically does not provide enterprise resource planning (ERP), whereas an ISP almost always does.
Which service provides the ability to automate the planning and operations of an entire organization?
Enterprise resource planning (ERP)
Software-as-a-service (SaaS)
Common Gateway Interface (CGI)
Web development project cycle
Which hosting solution is characterized by a service provider that allocates space for your equipment but does not provide the server hardware?
Co-location
Co-hosting
Virtual server
Dedicated hosting
Which of the following is typically an advantage to configuring your own hosting server over using an ISP or a cloud service provider?
You have more choices in the configuration.
You do not need to purchase software or hardware.
Configuring your own servers will take less time.
You do not need to purchase hardware.
What specific information would you need to obtain from an ISP or cloud service provider whose hosting services you wanted to use?
Account information, IP addresses, DNS server names, and file and directory location instructions
IP addresses, business plan and organizational chart
DNS server names, account information and business plan
Business plan, IP addresses, and file and directory location instructions
